title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O)
description: When invoking the New Java Package wizard, an empty package name field should not display the message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'. It is unclear what this message means and whether it indicates an error. If it is an error, it should be displayed in red with the error icon. Additionally, there should be a way to create a default package as it currently cannot be created by the user since it always exists.
OB: When invoking the New Java Package wizard with an empty package name field, a message appears at the top indicating 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'.
EB: When invoking the New Java Package wizard with an empty package name field, no message should be displayed. If the message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' is an error, it should be displayed in red with the error icon. There should also be a way to create a default package.
SR:
1. Launch the 'New Java Package' wizard.
2. Leave the package name field empty.
3. Verify that no message is displayed indicating the existence of a folder corresponding to the package name.
4. Verify that there is a way to create a default package.
